definition.p: A subset U\subseteq\mb R is called open if and only if for every point x\in U, there exists an open interval (a,b) such that x\in(a,b)\subseteq U.

example.p: Determine if each set is open or not open.

theorem.p: A subset U\subseteq\mb R is open if and only if there exists a collection of open intervals \mc U such that U=\bigcup\mc U.

proposition.p: Let x\in\mb R and S\subseteq\mb R. The point x is a limit point of the set S if and only if for every open set U containing x, there is a point y\in S such that x\not=y and y\in U.
